utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Hey! So what do you think?

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: New haircut? Necklace? Dress? Boots? Boots!

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Yes! Now, they’re a little more than I normally spend on boots…or rent

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Oh my God!

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: I know.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: I’m gonna miss being able to afford food.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: I’m sorry, they just, they just look so good! And the saleswoman was looking at me like, "Oh, these are way too expensive for you."

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: She had a point.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Hi!

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Hey.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Oh my God! Oh Monica! Those boots are amazing!

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: They’re mine!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Yeah well, too bad we’re gonna have to return them.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Return them?! Shh! They’re gonna hear you!

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Honey, I’m not returning them. Okay? I mean I-I know they cost a lot, but I’m going to wear them all the time. You’ll see. Besides, I love the compliments. I mean, have you ever had something so beautiful everyone wanted it?

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: I have you.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Nice try; I’m keeping the boots.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: That’s right, I love you! And-and I’m gonna play with you all the time.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: How can you let him talk to your crotch like that?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: He’s talking to the baby.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Ohh! Okay! Okay, cause when-when he said, "I can’t wait to hear your first words," I thought, "There’s a trick."

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Okay. Well, I gotta go you guys. I’ll see you later.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Okay.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Bye.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Bye.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Oh hey Rach, listen—Hi!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Hi.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Umm, can you do me a favor? I was talkin’ to my sister and she knows you work at Ralph Lauren…

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: No, forget it! No way! I am not sending anymore Ralph Lauren clothes to prison. It is a waste.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: No-no-no-no-no-no, not her, not her. My youngest sister, Dina, she’s really interested in fashion, and she wants to talk to someone successful, y’know, to give her some advice.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: I guess I can talk to one of my supervisors…

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Oh no-no-no-no, she wants to talk to you!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Really?! Oh my God! I’m successful!

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Okay, so will you meet with her?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Yes! I’d love to! Have her come by the office.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Great! Thanks! You’re gonna love her so much. And—Oh, she’s the smartest of all the Tribbiani children. Hey, y’know the S.A.T’s?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: She took ‘em!

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Hey Ross! Doesn’t Ben go to the Smithfield Day School?

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Yeah. Why?

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Sting has a son that goes there too!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Yeah I know; he’s in Ben’s class.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: You knew this and you never said anything?! With all the stupid dinosaur stuff you tell us?!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Fine! No more dinosaur stuff! Can I talk about fossils?

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Sting’s son, seven years old and there’s a picture.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: What are you reading? The Kidnappers Guide to Manhattan Private Schools?

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: No, it’s New York magazine. It’s an article about the best schools in the city. So how well do you know Sting?

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Uh, I actually haven’t even met him.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Uh-huh, yeah that’s too bad. I really want to go to his concert Friday night, but it’s totally sold out. I know! Why don’t you meet him and get tickets?! If you get two I’ll take you.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Well actually, I’m picking Ben up tomorrow, maybe he’ll be there.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: There you go! Oh, you are so lucky! You might actually get to meet Sting tomorrow! That’s why you have kids!

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Hey guys!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Hey-hey.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Hi Monica!

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Hey.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Hi boots.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: See Chandler? I’m getting a lot of use out of them already! They’re very practical. See, you can wear them with dresses, with skirts, with pants…

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: You can wear them with shorts on a street corner and earn the money to pay for them.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Wow! They’re beautiful!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Ahh…

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: They hurt so much!

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: What?!

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: The guy who made these hates feet and wants to see them die!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Well-well you can give them to me! I haven’t felt my feet in years!

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: I can’t! I spent so much money on them and I told Chandler that I’d wear them all the time, I just can’t give them away!

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Well then get your money back and return them!

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: I can’t do that either! The soles’ are already a little scuffed up and the insides are filled with my blood.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Hey!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Hey!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Hey I uh just picked up Ben from school…

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: I don’t think you did a very thorough job!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: I dropped him off at Carol’s. Anyway, it turns out that I’m not going to be able to get those tickets though.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Oh no! Why not?

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Well it turns out that Ben and Sting’s son do not get along.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: How come?!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Apparently, Sting’s son made fun of the fact that Ben’s moms are lesbinims.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Wait! But Ross if they don’t get along then you should smooth things over. Make them be friends.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Phoebe, you can’t force kids to be friends.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Sure you can! Give them some blocks, put them in a playpen!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Playpen?! Ben’s seven!

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Your kid is seven?! He’s really small. Please! Please get the tickets!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Look I’m sorry Pheebs, I can’t do it.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Yes you can! Sting says so himself!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: What?

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Rosssss can!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Look Phoebe, I’m sorry it’s just…

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Rossss can!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Phoebe, I…

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Rosss can! Give me the tickets! Ross can give me the tickets!!

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Here she is! Future fashion superstar!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Oh Joey, I’m hardly a…

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: My little sister Dina!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Right! Hi Dina!

utterance.speaker: Dina
utterance.content: Hi.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Nice to meet you.

utterance.speaker: Dina
utterance.content: Thanks so much for meetin’ with me. Joey’s told me so much about you!

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: This is so exciting for her. Well, I’ll let you two fash…ists get down to business.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Okay. All right Dina, well let’s talk about the different areas of fashion that you could get involved in. Let’s see, there’s design, but you may need a whole other degree for that. Uh, there’s-there’s sales, which is great because you get to travel…

utterance.speaker: Dina
utterance.content: I…I don’t care about fashion! I’m pregnant! And I know you are too, so you gotta help me!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: And there’s marketing…

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Ahhhhhhhh!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: What’s wrong?

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Oh nothing I’m just—just was yawning.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Oh don’t forget, my office holiday party is tonight.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Honey, we don’t really have to go to this thing tonight do we?

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Now sweetie, I know you don’t like my office parties, but you can wear your new boots. See? Every cloud has a…supple leather lining.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: I-I don’t-I don’t think that I’m gonna wear the boots tonight.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Why not?

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Well y’know, I’m just-I’m just worried that bosses will see them and think they pay you too much money. Or! Or your assistant will see them and-and want a raise!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Do you think I work at some kind of boot pricing company?

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Anyway, I picked up this outfit that I want to wear and the, and the boots don’t really go with it.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: You said that you paid all that money because those boots go with skirts, dresses, and pants!

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Fine! If you want me to wear the boots, I’ll wear the boots. In fact, I’ll go into my room right now and y’know try the outfit on.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Okay.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Okay? Ooo wee! Christmas party in my boots!

utterance.speaker: Dina
utterance.content: I-I can’t go in there. I can’t tell him!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Honey, it’s going to be okay. He’s been incredibly supportive of me, and if he gets a little upset; that’s what the meatball sub is for.

utterance.speaker: Dina
utterance.content: Thank you.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Okay.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Hey! It’s my fashion girls! What’s wrong?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Honey, why don’t you sit down? Dina has something that she wants to tell you.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Oh. What’s, what’s going on? Is it mom? Is she sick? Is it dad’s heart? Is that a sandwich?

utterance.speaker: Dina
utterance.content: Joe, mom and dad are fine…

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Is that a sandwich?!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Joey…there’s something that you…should know. Dina?

utterance.speaker: Dina
utterance.content: I’m pregnant.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: What?!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Now! Give him the sandwich! Give him the sandwich!

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Well obviously this is a mistake! You can’t be pregnant! Because you have to have sex to get pregnant!

utterance.speaker: Dina
utterance.content: Joe, I tried to wait until I was 25 like you did!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: What?! Dina…

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Bub!!! I can’t believe this! You’re the good one! You went to college! Both years! Who did this to you?!

utterance.speaker: Dina
utterance.content: Bobby Corso, but he’s a real nice guy. I like him a lot. He’s real funny.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: You got pregnant for funny?! Dina…if he’s funny…laugh! All right, I’ll be back in a little while! You stay here!

utterance.speaker: Dina
utterance.content: Why? Where are you going?

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: I can’t look at you right now!

utterance.speaker: Dina
utterance.content: Wow.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: I know.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Oh, there you are Ben!

utterance.speaker: Ben
utterance.content: Aunt Phoebe, what are you doing here?

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Well, I heard you’re having a problem with one of the boys in your class. And so I thought I would just come down here and sit you both down, have a little talk and make it all okay. Now umm, the boy’s name is Sting’s son.

utterance.speaker: Ben
utterance.content: Jack? I hate him! He’s a jerk.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Now Ben, sometimes people may seem like jerks on the outside, but they have famous fathers.

utterance.speaker: Ben
utterance.content: I have to go. My friend Doug is waiting for me over there.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Him you’re friends with.

utterance.speaker: The Teacher
utterance.content: Excuse me. Can, can I help you with something?

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Yes! Yes you can, I’m looking for Jack’s parents.

utterance.speaker: The Teacher
utterance.content: Are you with one of the students?

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Uh-huh, I’m with Ben.

utterance.speaker: The Teacher
utterance.content: Are you one of Ben’s mothers?

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: I am one of Ben’s mothers. I’m a lesbian. It was, it was difficult coming out to my parents.

utterance.speaker: The Teacher
utterance.content: Well hi, I’m Jenny Boone. I’m the new teacher here.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Oh.

utterance.speaker: The Teacher
utterance.content: I’ve only met your partner Carol.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Ah! Okay so that would make me Susan.

utterance.speaker: The Teacher
utterance.content: Right. Are you looking for Jack’s parents to discuss the problems he’s having with Ben? Yeah. Because I really do think the parents should sit down and have a conversation.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Yeah! Let’s do that!! That-that sounds good. We should sit down and talk, just me, my lover Carol, and the Stings. Umm, how-how will I get in touch with them?

utterance.speaker: The Teacher
utterance.content: Oh, their number is on the contact sheet.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Uh-huh. Uh-huh. Umm, could-could I get a copy of that? ‘Cause Carol threw it out, she lost ours. She’s such a scatterbrain, but man what a hot piece of ass.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Y’know, that party wasn’t bad.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Yeah! I didn’t know there would be dancing. That was a fun surprise!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: I don’t see any uh, cabs. Maybe we should just walk?

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Oh no, we can’t walk!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: What honey, it’s like fifteen blocks to the subway. Let’s go.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Hey! Do you think that we can get to the subway right there if we climb down through the manhole cover?

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: What’s going on?

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: I can’t walk. Okay? Okay? These boots were a huge mistake!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: What?

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Okay you were right! All right, I never should have bought them! They’re killing me! One toe at a time!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: So I was right. This is what it feels like to be right. It’s oddly unsettling.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: How are we gonna get home? Maybe a piggy-back ride?

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Hop on.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Okay. Wait, just give me a second, I need to just get my boots off first. Ah…Ooh…Oohh…Ohh…Oh God…Ohh…Oh…Ohh…Ohhhh…

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Honey, I know you’re in pain right now, but I’m a little turned on.

utterance.speaker: Dina
utterance.content: Do you ever worry that you’ll be walking and your baby will just like slip out?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: What college was that Dina?

utterance.speaker: Dina
utterance.content: Oh my God! Bobby!

utterance.speaker: Bobby
utterance.content: Hi Dina. Good to see you.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Joey, what are you doing?

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Just what needs to be done! Dearly beloved, we are gathered here to join this man and this woman…

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Oh Joey this is crazy!

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Don’t interrupt me when I’m talkin’ to God! Now where were we? Oh right, okay. Do you Dina, take this man…

utterance.speaker: Dina
utterance.content: No!

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Oh you’ll take ‘em!

utterance.speaker: Dina
utterance.content: No I won’t!

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Hey! You don’t get a say in this!

utterance.speaker: Dina
utterance.content: Yes I do!

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Ahhh! I heard "I do", we’re halfway there! Okay! You!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: All right Joey! That is enough! Listen, as beautiful and moving as this ceremony is, it’s not legal. Okay? They-they don’t have a marriage license, they don’t have any witnesses, and the groom only has on one shoe!

utterance.speaker: Bobby
utterance.content: Yeah, he took the other one off and hit me with it.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Well what am I supposed to do?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: You’re supposed to realize that they are adults! And that they can make their own decisions.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: No they can’t! They were stupid enough to get knocked up!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Heyyyyy! Contraceptives are not always effective! Right?

utterance.speaker: Bobby
utterance.content: Yeah…we kinda didn’t use any…

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Oh, come on kids! A little help here!

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Wow! This place is incredible! Sting’s pen…that he gave to Phoebe. Come on! Secret passageway!

utterance.speaker: Trudie Styler
utterance.content: Hi!

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Hi!

utterance.speaker: Trudie Styler
utterance.content: I’m Trudie.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Uh-huh.

utterance.speaker: Trudie Styler
utterance.content: You must be Ben’s mum.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Why else would I be here?

utterance.speaker: Trudie Styler
utterance.content: Do sit down.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Uh-huh.

utterance.speaker: Trudie Styler
utterance.content: I gather Jack and Ben haven’t been getting along lately.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: Trudie Styler
utterance.content: I’m told there are two sides to this story, but all I’ve heard is that Ben’s a bit of a poo-poo head.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Umm, I’m sorry. Won’t-won’t Jack’s father be joining us?

utterance.speaker: Trudie Styler
utterance.content: Oh I’m sorry, Jack’s father is not available.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Uh-hmm. Okay. Well then, could we reschedule? For say, Friday night perhaps at 8 o’clock?

utterance.speaker: Trudie Styler
utterance.content: Oh no, I know that wouldn’t work. My husband’s in concert.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Concert. Yeah. That does put us in…quite a pickle. Because you see I’m very busy before and after the concert, and he’s obviously busy during.

utterance.speaker: Trudie Styler
utterance.content: So, I guess you and I should talk about Jack and Ben right now.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Unless! Unless umm, okay I-I would be willing to go to the concert, umm, all the while thinking about the children of course.

utterance.speaker: Trudie Styler
utterance.content: Are you here for tickets?

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Oh, thank you. Four would be great.

utterance.speaker: Trudie Styler
utterance.content: I’m not giving concert tickets to someone who’d use their son like this!

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Oh good! Then you’re in luck! Ben’s not my son!

utterance.speaker: Trudie Styler
utterance.content: Look, I’ve just pressed a button, triggering a silent alarm. Any minute now, the police will be here!

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: The Police? Here? A reunion?!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Okay, ten blocks down. Five to go.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Oh wait! Stop! Stop! Stop!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Oh I’m sorry! Do you need a break?

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: My boots in tan! Hey! Can you get a little closer so I can see the price?

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: I can see it from right here. It’ll cost you one husband.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Okay, I’m sorry. I think I can walk the rest of the way now. Just-just give me my boots.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: I don’t have your boots.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Well I don’t have them either. Where are they?

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Well, why don’t you check in one of my saddlebags while I chew on a bale of hay!

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Okay. God well, we gotta go back and get them!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Honey, are you seriously ever gonna wear the boots again?

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Okay, I’m never gonna wear them again. I just didn’t get a chance to say goodbye.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Y’know what? You can say goodbye to the tan ones.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Okay. All right.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Okay.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Bye boots—Wait! Half off?!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Joey, just because they’re not getting married doesn’t mean this is going to be a disaster. Maybe they have a plan!

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Oh? Oh! Okay! Okay! Let’s hear their plan! Now, what’s the future look like for Dina and Bobby?

utterance.speaker: Bobby
utterance.content: Well…I really have high hopes for my band.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: You were right. He is funny.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Hey, now wait a minute! I get when you told people at first that you wanted to be an actor they laughed at you! Now come on Bobby, why don’t you tell us a little bit about your band?

utterance.speaker: Bobby
utterance.content: Well it’s just me and my pal Rooster, the band’s name is Numb Nuts.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Really?

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Dina, if you’re having a baby you should be married! Even if it is to Bobby! Dude, that’s not a compliment!

utterance.speaker: Dina
utterance.content: No Joey! I knew you wouldn’t be supportive!

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: So whoa-whoa-whoa-whoa! What are you gonna do? You’re gonna have the baby and-and raise it by yourself…without a husband?! You can’t be a single mother alone! You’re gonna ruin your life!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Oh excuse me! Am I ruining my life?

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: No! No! No! It’s different for you. You’re so strong and together. You’re not some dumb kid who doesn’t know what she’s doing.

utterance.speaker: Dina
utterance.content: Excuse me?

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: One pregnant woman at a time, please! I just want you to be okay.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: So forcing her to marry Bobby is gonna make that happen?

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Maybe! Well! Well…so-so uh, what kind of music does Numb Nuts—Oh forget it! I can’t!

utterance.speaker: Dina
utterance.content: Joey, I am scared to death about this. But I really think I can do it, I’m just gonna need some help. And Bobby’s gonna be here the whole time.

utterance.speaker: Bobby
utterance.content: You bet I am! And to answer your earlier question, we’re straight-up gangster rap.

utterance.speaker: Dina
utterance.content: Look, Rachel’s told me how much easier you’ve made all this on her. Why can’t you do that for me?

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Because! ‘Cause… ‘Cause you’re my baby sister!

utterance.speaker: Dina
utterance.content: And you’re my big brother! I mean, you’re my favorite guy in the whole world. I’m not even scared to tell mom and dad. I was scared of telling you.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Well I’d be scared of them, but all right.

utterance.speaker: Dina
utterance.content: Joey, I can’t stand the thought of having this baby with you mad at me. I want him to have his uncle. Is my baby gonna have his Uncle Joey?

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Of course he’s gonna have his Uncle Joey!

utterance.speaker: Dina
utterance.content: We’re gonna be all right. I mean, even if we’re not married this baby is gonna be so loved. Not just by us.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: That’s right! By his uncle too!

utterance.speaker: Bobby
utterance.content: And by you.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Okay Bobby, why don’t we just come over here and let them have a little moment.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Come here!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: No! Seriously! What’s wrong with you?!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: You’re gonna love me so much. I got Sting tickets!!

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Oh my God! I do love you! How did you do it?!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Well…let’s just say… Rosss caaaaan!

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Oo, where are the seats?

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Uh, middle balcony.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Okay, now would you say that that’s more than 50 yards away from Sting, his wife, or a member of his family?

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Then that’s not breaking the law! I’m there!
